result.execSummary:
The defendant Clayton S. McDaniel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Clayton S. McDaniel is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Clayton S. McDaniel was found guilty of Theft-Business Setting <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Spoke w/ Deft, explained that the COCC had not received his payment or application. Deft stated he would bring his receipt for the money order and cash to the COCC on Thursday 10/20/2016. If no payment is made warrant can be processed.

2:33 Defendant Clayton S. McDaniel in court with attorney Chad Lynch.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Schiek recites agreement. State moves to amend Count 1 - to Theft in business setting, a Misdemeanor violating 943.20(3)(a) - Granted. State moves to dismiss Count 2 - Granted. Plea questionnaire filed. Defendant enters no contest plea.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Schiek/Lynch/Court statement on sentencing. Victim Impact Statement filed.
Court Sentence
WHS/POP- 12 months
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fee
  Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Jail - 5 days with Huber for all purposes. To commence on/before Friday August 12, 2016 at 4:00 p.m. 
Jail credit - 
Restitution - $5,087.95 plus 10% surcharge of $508.79 for  a total of $5,596.74.
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO
Appeal rights given. Payment plan application fee given.
Adj. 2:50 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for October 10, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Clayton S. McDaniel in court with attorney Chad Lynch.  Mary Margaret Sowinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Sowinski statement to court - Atty Lynch statement to court - just took over this case recently and states very close to resolution and states substantial amount of restitution involved and would like more time to get through financial records and meet with DA's Office.  Court statement to court - notes has read through record and will grant request to adjourn.  Court will continue Pretrial Conference on July 12th at 1:30 p.m.  Atty Sowinski requests all bond conditions continue - Court grants that all bond conditions continue.  
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 12, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

2:16 p.m. Defendant Clayton S. McDaniel in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State has made proposal - Hogan states there is a significant amount of restitution at issue; requests additional time to discuss restitution and allow defendant to save money for up front restitution payment. Bail continued. Adj. 2:19 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 12, 2016 at 11:45 am.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery  - includes cover letter
Attachment to State's Discovery
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery  - includes cover letter

10:10 a.m. Defendant Clayton S. McDaniel in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. Hogan states restitution needs to be determined - requests pre-trial date. Will proceed to arraignment at pre-trial - Information to be filed within 30 days of today. Bail continued. Adj. 10:13 a.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 19, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

2:49 P.M. Defendant Clayton S. McDaniel in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading -set for preliminary hearing - Time limits waived
Bail continued. Adj. 2:49 P.M.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 2, 2016 at 10:15 am.

3:31 p.m. Defendant Clayton S. McDaniel in court.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant states is not eligible for public defender - was out of town for family funeral in Texas. Defendant given petition for court appointed attorney. Bail continued. Adj. 3:33 p.m.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 4, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
